definition[0]: a larger company that takes control of smaller ones
example[0]: In view of its size, the company has been seen as a possible consolidator in the European insurance industry.
definition[1]: a business that brings together and sells at a reduced price things that other producers or suppliers have not been able to sell
example[1]: Consolidators buy up surplus airline tickets and offer bargain prices.
definition[2]: a transport company that combines small loads sent by different companies into bigger ones
example[2]: Container transport documents are issued frequently by freight forwarders or consolidators.
